LineAnnotation Class

In this Article

Represents a line annotation.

Syntax

Declaration

public class LineAnnotation : System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • ChartElement
  • ChartNamedElement
  • System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation
  • LineAnnotation

Constructors

  • LineAnnotation()

    Initializes a new instance of the LineAnnotation class.

    public LineAnnotation ();

Properties

  • Alignment

    This property is not applicable to the line annotation type.

    public override System.Drawing.ContentAlignment Alignment { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ContentAlignment

      A ContentAlignment enumeration value.

  • AnchorAlignment

    Gets or sets the position alignment of an annotation to the anchor point.

    public override System.Drawing.ContentAlignment AnchorAlignment { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ContentAlignment

      A ContentAlignment value that represents the annotation alignment to the anchor point.

    Remarks

    The annotation must be anchored using either AnchorDataPoint, or the AnchorX and AnchorY properties. Its X and Y properties must be set to NaN.

  • AnnotationType

    Gets the type of annotation.

    public override string AnnotationType { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The annotation type.

    Remarks

    For internal use, should not be used.

  • BackColor

    This property is not applicable to the line annotation type.

    public override System.Drawing.Color BackColor { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Color

      A Color value.

  • BackGradientStyle

    This property is not applicable to the line annotation type.

    public override System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.GradientStyle BackGradientStyle { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • GradientStyle

      A GradientStyle enumeration value.

  • BackHatchStyle

    This property is not applicable to the line annotation type.

    public override System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartHatchStyle BackHatchStyle { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ChartHatchStyle

      A ChartHatchStyle value.

  • BackSecondaryColor

    This property is not applicable to the line annotation type.

    public override System.Drawing.Color BackSecondaryColor { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Color

      A Color value.

  • EndCap

    Gets or sets a style for the anchor cap at the end of the annotation line.

    public virtual System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.LineAnchorCapStyle EndCap { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • LineAnchorCapStyle

      A LineAnchorCapStyle enumeration value that represents the style to apply to the anchor cap at the end of the line.

  • Font

    This property is not applicable to the line annotation type.

    public override System.Drawing.Font Font { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Font

      A Font object.

  • ForeColor

    This property is not applicable to the line annotation type.

    public override System.Drawing.Color ForeColor { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Color

      A Color value.

  • IsInfinitive

    Gets or sets a flag that indicates whether an infinite line should be drawn.

    public virtual bool IsInfinitive { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      True if a line should be drawn infinitely through two points provided, otherwise false.

  • IsSizeAlwaysRelative

    Gets or sets a flag that specifies whether the size of an annotation is always defined in relative chart coordinates.

    public override bool IsSizeAlwaysRelative { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      True if the stem.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.Width* and stem.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.Height* of an annotation are always in chart relative coordinates, otherwise false.

    Remarks

    The width and height of an annotation may be set in relative chart or in axes coordinates. By default, relative chart coordinates are used. To use axes coordinates for the annotation size, set the IsSizeAlwaysRelative property to false. Then anchor the annotation to a data point or set the AxisX or AxisY properties.

  • StartCap

    Gets or sets a style for the anchor cap at the start of an annotation line.

    public virtual System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.LineAnchorCapStyle StartCap { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • LineAnchorCapStyle

      A LineAnchorCapStyle enumeration value that represents the style to apply to the anchor cap at the start of the line.

  • TextStyle

    This property is not applicable to the line annotation type.

    public override System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextStyle TextStyle { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TextStyle

      A TextStyle enumeration value.
